original_title: Hurricane Erin’s path poses a serious threat to North Carolina’s Outer Banks and dangerous surf up the East Coast | CNN
article_summary: Hurricane Erin, a high-end Category 2 storm, is churning up dangerous coastal conditions along the US East Coast, particularly North Carolina's Outer Banks. Tropical storm warnings and watches are in effect, and mandatory evacuations have been issued. The hurricane is not forecast to make landfall but will bring life-threatening rip currents, large surf, and coastal flooding.</s>
